sectionDescription: Properties which define how the Element is grouped

fields.description: The Element should exists in an 'all' group rather than a 'sequence' group.
The Element should exist in a 'choice' group rather than a 'sequence' group. The name isn't written to the XSD however it is used to identify distinct groups of elements.

sectionDescription: Properties which define the Element attribute

fields.description: The element is an XSD attribute for a ComplexType rather than being an XSD Element.
The name of the attribute which this element actually maps to when defined as a complex type. Only used from an import to signify an element which is a simple type masquerading as a complex type

sectionDescription: Properties which define the Element values

fields.description: The default value for the element. This is advice to the user of the XSD that if the element is not supplied then it will be set to the default.
The 'fixed' value of the element. This informs the user that the element's value is fixed to the one supplied and cannot be overridden.

sectionDescription: Properties which are applied defining the schema for the element

fields.description: The target namespace for the Element in the XSD if different from the namespace defined at the schema level.
The optional prefix used to define the target namespace.
